abstract: Folk singer and songwriter Bob Dylan, who has won Nobel Prize for Literature, lived out complex but extraordinarily fertile romance with New York City during what was arguably his most creative period in 1960s and 1970s; Dylan, whose rise to fame started in Greenwich Village coffeehouses and cafes, now lives in Malibu, Calif.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Dylan may have styled himself early on as a vagabond country boy, but those familiar with his life know he first rose to prominence as a driven folk singer in Greenwich Village coffeehouses.
snippet: Mr. Dylan may have styled himself early on as a vagabond country boy, but those familiar with his life know he first rose to prominence as a driven folk singer in Greenwich Village coffeehouses....

headline.main: Bob Dylan and New York: A Complicated, Fertile Romance
headline.print_headline: Dylan and New York Share a Complex, Fertile Romance
